Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2010 04:54PM mslp wrote: I got the pathology report back today, and thankfully it was benign.  Thank you to those who responded with such great encouragement and information.  It is amazing to me how little the drs. really share, and how much you need to search for on your own.  Again, thank you.
Posts.Title: Ultrasound showed 1.7 cm mass mslp mslp

Posts.Content: mslp wrote: I had an ultrasound to follow up on the repeat mamogram which had showed  a density in my right breast.  The ultrasound showed a 1.7 cm circumscribed mass with a central fatty hilum, and blood flow seen in the hilar region.  It was an ACR 4.  The radiologist recommended a core biopsy.  He said it was suggestive of a lymph node.  If he really just thinks it is a lymph node, which from what I have been reading can swell at the drop of a hat, why didn't he just suggest a follow up mamogram or ultrasound, to see if it changes?  I made an appt with a breast surgeon, and they won't do the biopsy until I come in for a consultation, and then decide whether or not I need a biopsy.  All this waiting over the last three weeks has me really stressed out.  I feel like it is probably nothing, but why the ACR 4, if he really just thinks it is a lymph node? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ultrasound showed 1.7 cm mass mslp mslp

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2010 05:53PM mslp wrote: So why recommend a core needle biopsy?
Posts.Title: Ultrasound showed 1.7 cm mass mslp mslp

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2010 03:59PM mslp wrote: Got to talk to the surgeon today.  She said that what I had was a tubular adenoma.  I am a little out of the age range for that, but that is the diagnosis.  I am still a little curious though about what the radiologist described with the bloodflow in the hilar region, and then final diagnosis of the tubular adenoma.  I guess I don't know enough about anatomy.  She said that what the radiologist saw was definitely not a lymph node.  I'm  just glad for the b9 results, but very curious about what one dr. vs. another dr. sees.
Posts.Title: Ultrasound showed 1.7 cm mass mslp mslp

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2010 09:09PM mslp wrote: Thanks for the reply.  It is very difficult to find any info about the lymph nodes in the breast.  I have not been too worried about it except that I keep wondering why order the biopsy, if he really thought that it was just a lymph node, why not just watch it, and order another ultrasound.
Posts.Title: Ultrasound showed 1.7 cm mass mslp mslp

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2010 03:21PM mslp wrote: I met with the surgeon, for a consultation.  She is going to do the biopsy on Wed.  She looked at my films with me and compared this year's to last years.  There is a small spot on last year's film in the same place as the mass they called me back for this year.  She did not go over the radiologists report, but she mentioned that she could see possible spiculations?  I am still hopeful that this is nothing, but when she said that and showed me the dopplar color portion of the ultrasound, with the blood flow, I started to get a bit worried.  Now I just have to sit tight and wait for the biopsy and then the results.
Posts.Title: Ultrasound showed 1.7 cm mass mslp mslp

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2010 05:43PM mslp wrote: I had the stereotactic biopsy today.  It was not too bad, but now I have a raging headache, probably from the worrying about what the results will be.  The surgeon was fairly confident that she would have the results tomorrow.  Waiting and hoping for B9 results.
